sub_title: S&OP Leader at Philips Hospital Patient Monitoring
summary:
I have a master in Financial Controlling and performed various Financial Controller roles in Philips from 1991 till 2014. I have controlling experience in factories, sales organizations and at corporate level. Besides Financial Controller roles, I have set up shared Finance services in cooperation with Infosys, implemented SAP in sales organizations and set up a Joint Venture in Saudi Arabia.

In 2014, I joint Philips global Supply Chain Leadership, first as Financial Controller and in 2018 I transitioned from Finance into Supply Chain Management. As Supply Chain leader for Patient Monitoring I have set up a weekly S&OE process with our main Market North America. In 2019, I became S&OP leader for Business Unit Hospital Patient Monitoring. There I established a monthly S&OP cycle across HPM (2Bn+ euro). Establishing this process was key to manoeuvre through the Covid crisis (demand hike) in 2020 and the E-components crisis (supply constraints) in 2021-2022. Forecast accuracy since mid 2021 consistently above 70%, peaking above 90% in certain months. 

I have been active in national, regional and global roles. I have worked in The Netherlands, Germany, Austria, Switzerland, Eastern Europe, Russia, Ukraine, Middle East and USA.

profile_positions.description: Took up a new role as Sales & Operational Planning Leader in Business Unit Hospital Patient Monitoring. Established a monthly S&OP cycle across HPM (2FBn+) to align on our 18 month demand plan vs our 18 month capability to supply, including follow up on demand - supply gaps, culminating in a monthly BU HPM S&OP meeting for decision making. Forecast accuracy since mid 2021 consistently above 70%, peaking above 90% in certain months. Establishing this process was key to manoeuvre through the Covid crisis (demand hike) in 2020 and the E-components crisis (supply constraints) in 2021-2022. Besides we established a bi-annual 5-year planning process, capturing long term demand changes in combination with the impact of strategic programs. Finally, my team runs a weekly Sales & Operational Execution process with all HPM Market organizations to manage demand-supply issues in the running & next quarter.

profile_positions.description:
Part of the global Supply Chain Leadership Team of Royal Philips. Together with Businesses and Markets we tried on a daily basis to surpass the expectations of our customers in such a way that is efficient & compliant for Philips. Besides we were building the future SCM landscape of Royal Philips.

As controller I was actively involved in developing and executing upon our strategies to shape the future SCM landscape: various Inventory optimization programs, Integral Warehouse & Distribution (insourcing of Transport Management and Warehouse rationalization), Business Process Outsourcing (GBS) and process harmonization & automation (Blueheart).

Besides, I played a central role in performance management. Through measurement of financial and non-financial KPI's relevant for SCM from Executive Committee level to sites, we were driving performance. I was personally driving performance management with Executive Committee and Health Systems Markets. Some concrete results in this field: Development of KPI review system for Health Systems Markets, Royal Philips inventory reduction ('14 15,5% -> '17 13,0% of sales), Royal Philips Warehousing & Distribution cost reduction ('15 4,96% -> '17 4,42% of sales). Finally, I was also responsible for Budgeting, Forecasting, Compliance and Internal Controls.
